author: MarÃ­a Clara Albisu
title: Un rescate emocionante, evacuados y destrucciÃ³n: la tragedia de las inundaciones en Brasil
text:
El cataclismo climÃ¡tico de las inundaciones producidas por la lluvia en el sur de Brasil sigue aumentando el conteo de daÃ±os.
MÃ¡s de 85 % del territorio del estado de Rio Grande do Sul fue afectado por las inundaciones, unas 68.000 personas se han visto obligadas a vivir en refugios adaptados y mÃ¡s de 327.000 debieron abandonar sus casas.
A escala nacional, las inundaciones masivas han dejado al menos 113 muertos y 134 desaparecidos, mientras que los afectados totales superan ya los 1,7 millones.
Sin embargo, la vÃ­ctima de la tragedia que recorriÃ³ las redes y las portadas de las publicaciones mÃ¡s importantes del mundo fue un caballo, Caramelo. El animal fue rescatado del techo de una vivienda totalmente anegada por un equipo especial de defensa civil.
ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡· | ÃšLTIMO MINUTO
Equipos de emergencias rescatan a â€˜Carameloâ€™, el caballo que se volviÃ³ viral al quedar atrapado en un tejado en Canoas, Brasil. pic.twitter.com/ZGWOQ0y6iq
â€” UHN PLUS (@UHN_Plus) May 9, 2024
En tanto, el presidente De Brasil, Luiz InÃ¡cio Lula da Silva, anunciÃ³ un nuevo paquete de ayudas de 50.000 millones de reales (9.800 millones de dÃ³lares) para la reconstrucciÃ³n del estado devastado por unas inÃ©ditas inundaciones.
Los fondos servirÃ¡n principalmente para la entrega de crÃ©ditos a trabajadores, empresas y municipios afectados por el desastre climÃ¡tico. â€œEstÃ¡ todo el paÃ­s sensibilizado para atender lo mÃ¡s rÃ¡pidamente posible a las personasâ€, declarÃ³ Lula en la ceremonia, en la cual insistiÃ³ en que es â€œinmediatoâ€ atender con urgencia â€œla tragediaâ€ que afecta a 1,5 millones de personas y mantiene parcialmente bajo las aguas a 425 municipios.
El ministro de Hacienda, Fernando Haddad, detallÃ³ las medidas que serÃ¡n propuestas al Parlamento, que incluyen planes asistenciales directos, crÃ©ditos subvencionados para pequeÃ±as y medianas empresas, y asistencia para productores rurales, trabajadores asalariados, desempleados y beneficiarios de ayudas sociales.
SegÃºn Lula, la semana prÃ³xima serÃ¡n anunciadas otras medidas, que contemplan una renegociaciÃ³n de la deuda de RÃ­o Grande do Sul con el Tesoro brasileÃ±o y tambiÃ©n en favor â€œde las personas que perdieron su televisor o su heladeraâ€, que â€œpara muchos pueden ser poca cosa, pero para los pobres son verdaderos tesorosâ€.
â€œVamos a tener que prepararnos porque veremos el tamaÃ±o de los problemas cuando el agua baje y los rÃ­os vuelvan a la normalidadâ€, dijo Lula. â€œMucha gente perdiÃ³ mucho y tenemos que tener eso en cuentaâ€, aÃ±adiÃ³. El presidente de la CÃ¡mara de Diputados, Arthur Lira, garantizÃ³ en la ceremonia la â€œinmediata tramitaciÃ³nâ€ de esa propuesta, a fin de contribuir a â€œaliviar el sufrimientoâ€ de la poblaciÃ³n del sur del paÃ­s.
Una de las peores consecuencias que afronta la poblaciÃ³n es haberse quedado sin hogar.
Las inundaciones damnificaron al menos 61.400 viviendas, de las que 6.200 quedaron totalmente destruidas, segÃºn datos parciales divulgados este miÃ©rcoles por la ConfederaciÃ³n Nacional de los Municipios.
La entidad calcula en 6.400 millones de reales (unos 1.280 millones de dÃ³lares o 1.191 millones de euros) los daÃ±os provocados hasta ahora por la mayor tragedia ambiental registrada en RÃ­o Grande do Sul, estado del sur de Brasil fronterizo con Argentina y Uruguay.
Cerca de la mitad de esas pÃ©rdidas, unos 3.400 millones de reales, se refieren precisamente a los daÃ±os sufridos por las viviendas.
Las autoridades aÃºn desconocen el costo de la reconstrucciÃ³n, pues la verdadera magnitud de los daÃ±os solo podrÃ¡ ser calculada una vez que las aguas bajen.
Refugiados en riesgo Al a 41.000 refugiados asilados en Brasil y procedentes de Venezuela y HaitÃ­, fueron afectados por las inundaciones, advirtiÃ³ la Agencia de la ONU para los Refugiados (Acnur) este viernes.
â€œMuchos venezolanos y haitianos viven en zonas afectadas a las cuales sÃ³lo se puede llegar en barcoâ€, asegurÃ³ el portavoz de la organizaciÃ³n, William Spindler, en rueda de prensa.
SegÃºn datos de Acnur, Rio Grande do Sul acoge a mÃ¡s de 21.000 venezolanos reubicados desde el estado de Roraima, en la frontera norte con Venezuela, y que recibe al mayor nÃºmero de refugiados.

author: @JornadaWeb
title: El Hospital Ãsola realizÃ³ la primera cirugÃ­a de catarata a un niÃ±o
text: El Gobierno del Chubut, a travÃ©s de la SecretarÃ­a de Salud provincial, destacÃ³ una importante cirugÃ­a oftalmolÃ³gica que recientemente se realizÃ³ a un niÃ±o de diez aÃ±os, quien presentaba cataratas congÃ©nitas en ambos ojos, en el Hospital Zonal â€œDr. AndrÃ©s Ãsolaâ€ de Puerto Madryn. El equipo de oftalmologÃ­a pediÃ¡trica evaluÃ³ la posibilidad de realizar la intervenciÃ³n para mejorar la calidad de visiÃ³n del paciente, â€œy de esta manera, se le operÃ³ un ojo y, mÃ¡s adelante, se operarÃ¡ el otroâ€, detallÃ³ el mÃ©dico oftalmÃ³logo JuliÃ¡n Sahagun, quien encabezÃ³ la intervenciÃ³n junto con su colega Julia Korth. Equipo mÃ©dico capacitado Se trata de una prÃ¡ctica que, si bien es habitual, requiere de un equipo mÃ©dico capacitado que la realice. En tal sentido, en esta ocasiÃ³n se pudo concretar ya que el Hospital de Puerto Madryn cuenta con los especialistas y el equipo de quirÃ³fano estÃ¡ adaptado a tal fin. â€œEn nuestro hospital contamos con todo ello, por lo que se pudo resolver acÃ¡, evitando una derivaciÃ³n a un centro de mayor complejidadâ€, resaltÃ³ JuliÃ¡n Sahagun. Asimismo, desde la SecretarÃ­a de Salud se destacÃ³ el trabajo articulado del personal de salud del establecimiento asistencial, tanto del Departamento QuirÃºrgico como del Servicio de OftalmologÃ­a, que llevÃ³ adelante este procedimiento en un niÃ±o por primera vez, lo cual tiene un gran valor, ya que permitirÃ¡ mejorar el desarrollo visual y la calidad de vida del paciente.

author: Patrick Cooley
title: Nativity Scene With Two Mothers Has Conservative Catholics Up in Arms - The Messenger
text: [ESPNâ€™s Stephen A. Smith Says a Cowboys Fan Punched Him at a Dallas Airport for Trash Talking the Team](/sports/espns-stephen-a-smith-says-a-cowboys-fan-punched-him-at-a-dallas-airport-for-trash-talking-the-team?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=trending_story) Nativity Scene With Two Mothers Has Conservative Catholics Up in Arms Joseph, husband of Mary, is replaced with another woman in nativity scene featured at a church in a Southern Italian village, according to Reuters. [Patrick Cooley](/author/patrick-cooley) An obscure Catholic church in Southern Italy finds itself at the center of controversy on the weekend before Christmas after it featured a nativity scene with two mothers, Reuters reported. Nativity scenes generally depict an infant Jesus with his mother, the Virgin Mary, and her husband, Joseph. But at the Church of Saints Peter and Paul in the Southern Italian hamlet of Capocastello di Mercogliano, Joseph is nowhere to be found, according to pictures posted on social media and featured in various media outlets. In his place is another woman. A petition [calling for the removal of the nativity scene](https://www-provitaefamiglia-it.translate.goog/petizione/no-alla-strumentalizzazione-blasfema-lgbtq-del-presepe-firma-ora?_x_tr_sl=it&_x_tr_tl=en&_x_tr_hl=en&_x_tr_pto=sc) has been circulated online by the conservative group Pro-Vita & Famiglia (pro-life and family). It has drawn more than 23,000 signatures. However, anyone around the globe can sign the petition and its unclear how many signatories are from Italy. Father Vitaliano Della, priest of the church in the Italian province of Avellino, [defended the scene](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/blasphemous-same-sex-nativity-scene-angers-conservatives-italy-2023-12-23/) in an interview with Reuters. "I wanted to show with this scene that families are no longer just the traditional ones," he said. "In our parishes we see more and more children from the new types of families that exist and are part of our society, children of separated and divorced people, gay couples, single people, young mothers." [Pope Francis Criticizes Conservative American Catholics for â€˜Backwardsâ€™ Views](/news/pope-francis-criticizes-conservative-american-catholics-for-backwards-views?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Mother with Children Named â€˜Aryanâ€™ and â€˜Nationâ€™ Charged in Death of Native American Woman](/news/mother-with-children-named-aryan-and-nation-charged-in-death-of-native-american-woman?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Schools in Italy Could be Fined if They Skip the Nativity Display Under Proposed Law](/news/italy-schools-potential-fines-refusing-nativity-displays-giorgia-meloni?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [â€˜The Marvelsâ€™ Post Credit Scenes Explained: Two New Superhero Teams Are Poised to Join the MCU](/entertainment/the-marvels-ending-post-credits-kelsey-grammer-beast-hailee-steinfeld-kate-bishop-x-men-young-avengers?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Speed Mauiâ€™s Recovery with a New Civilian Conservation Corps](/opinion/speed-mauis-recovery-with-a-new-civilian-conservation-corps?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Arrest Made in Fatal Shooting of Kentucky Teacher at Catholic University in Washington, D.C.](/news/arrest-made-in-fatal-shooting-of-kentucky-teacher-at-catholic-university-in-washington-d-c?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) News of the nativity scene broke just days after Pope Francis, in a landmark decision, [allowed priests to bless same-sex couples](https://themessenger.com/news/pope-francis-approves-blessing-same-sex-couples-priests) with the understanding that those blessings are not connected to the sacrament of marriage. Pro-Vita & Famiglia [called the nativity scene](https://www-provitaefamiglia-it.translate.goog/blog/vescovo-suetta-presepe-con-due-mamme-e-offesa-allintelligenza-e-colossale-bugia?_x_tr_sl=it&_x_tr_tl=en&_x_tr_hl=en&_x_tr_pto=sc) â€œblasphemousâ€ and â€œa colossal lie" in a lengthy statement on its website. Joseph, the group says in the petition calling for the nativity sceneâ€™s removal, was â€œsacrificed at the altar of political correctness.â€ The group called for the bishop of Avellino, Monsignor Arturo Aiello, to order the sceneâ€™s removal. author: ZhuangZhuang Wu
title: Xanthohumol inhibits osteosarcoma proliferation, migration, and invasion via EFEMP1/PI3K/AKT axis
text:
Background
Osteosarcoma (OS) is a tumor of bone. Xanthohumol (XN) has been found to have antitumor effects. However, it is not known whether XN can prevent the development of OS.
Method
The malignant phenotypes of OS cell lines were evaluated using CCK-8, clone-formation, EdU, Transwell, and wound-healing assays. The molecular mechanism of XN action was investigated by transcriptome sequencing. mRNA levels in OS cells were examined by q-PCR and protein by western blotting and immunofluorescence, while Ki-67 and PCNA levels in tumors were assessed using immunohistochemistry.
Results
XN dose-dependently blocked proliferation, migration, and invasion in OS cell lines. Transcriptome sequencing revealed that EFEMP1 expression was significantly reduced after XN treatment, which was shown by rescue assays to have a tumor-suppressive effect. Reduced levels of EFEMP1/PI3K/AKT axis after XN treatment were demonstrated by western blotting.
Conclusion
XN blocks OS tumorigenic behavior by inhibition of the EFEMP1/PI3K/AKT axis.

author: Reuters
title: High market hopes raise stakes as US stocks face inflation data, earnings
text: By Lewis Krauskopf NEW YORK (Reuters) â€“ Investorsâ€™ hopes are running high to start 2024, which could set up U.S. stocks for a rocky stretch if some expectations are not met. Despite a shaky start to the year, the S&P 500 stands only around 2% below a fresh record high. Most investors have maintained a rosy view on everything from the U.S. economy and corporate profits to the Federal Reserveâ€™s monetary policy trajectory. For example, the narrative of resilient growth and gradually cooling inflation that helped boost the S&P 500 to a 24% gain last year has become the consensus view among investors. The latest BofA Global Research survey, released last month, showed 66% of fund managers believed the economy will achieve a soft landing in 2024. Only 15% of fund managers expected a recession in the next 12 months, BofAâ€™s data showed, a sharp contrast from a year earlier, when 68% of investors expected a recession. Bets on easier monetary policy have gone hand-in-hand with the soft-landing outlook. Futures tied to the Fedâ€™s policy rates show investors pricing in around 140 basis points of interest rate cuts this year, nearly twice what the central bank itself has projected. Not surprisingly, many investors have a positive outlook on stocks. Bullish sentiment rose to 48.6% in the latest week â€” a notch down from its recent peak in December, but well above the historic average of 37.5%, the American Association of Individual Investors survey showed. Those views have been shaped in large part by tangible evidence of cooling inflation, a comparatively strong economy and the Fedâ€™s own guidance, after policymakers surprised markets with a dovish pivot last month. With stocks near historical highs and at elevated valuations, however, some investors worry the marketâ€™s sunny outlook leaves more room for disappointment if any of those scenarios do not materialize. â€œAnything that throws off the current economic narrative or market narrative â€“ the risk of that disappointment flowing through to prices in equities is higher,â€ said Yung-Yu Ma, chief investment officer at BMO Wealth Management. One test of investorsâ€™ optimism comes with next weekâ€™s consumer price data, which could show whether recent bets on ebbing inflation have been premature. Expectations for a cooling economy that could set the stage for Fed rate cuts took a hit on Friday, after jobs data showed employers hired more workers than expected in December while raising wages at a solid clip. The S&P 500 fell 1.54% this week, the biggest weekly decline since late October. Major banks including JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup kick off earnings season next week, testing elevated expectations for corporate profits. Analysts expect S&P 500 earnings to rise by 11% in 2024 after increasing just 3% in 2023, according to LSEG data. Pressure to meet higher earnings targets may be more intense than a year ago, as the marketâ€™s overall valuation has climbed. The S&P 500 trades at a forward price-to-earnings ratio of 19.5 compared with about 17 times at the start of 2023, LSEG Datastream data showed. â€œWe donâ€™t expect multiples to expand significantly from here because valuations are stretched a bit, so itâ€™s going to come down to where the earnings come in,â€ said James Ragan, director of wealth management research at D.A. Davidson. Ragan puts fair value for the S&P 500 at 4,700, roughly where it is trading now. Looking further ahead, investors will parse the message from the Fed at the end of its Jan. 30-31 policy meeting. Markets expect the central bank to leave rates unchanged this month, and bets on a cut at the March meeting have been pared back. Futures markets on Friday priced a roughly 62% chance that the Fed cuts rates by 25 basis points in March, from around 73% a week ago, CMEâ€™s FedWatch Tool showed. Still, stocks have historically responded well to rate cuts. Over the past 12 easing cycles since 1970, the S&P 500 has tended to rally for the six or seven months after the first rate cut with an average gain of about 12%, according to Ned Davis Research. Keith Lerner, co-chief investment officer at Truist Advisory Services, said in a recent note that the bar for positive surprises has risen and he expects a â€œdigestion periodâ€ for the market after its strong run. He still believes, however, that stocks are likely to rise in 2024. â€œStick with the underlying positive market trend and be prepared to use pullbacks as opportunities,â€ Lerner said. (Reporting by Lewis Krauskopf; Editing by Ira Iosebashvili, David Gregorio and Leslie Adler)

CES 2021 : Sony perfectionne son Concept Vision-S
Avec 45 capteurs placÃ©s Ã  l'intÃ©rieur et Ã  l'extÃ©rieur, Sony et Honda souhaitent que leur modÃ¨le soit capable d'Ãªtre â€œÃ  l'Ã©coute des sentiments du conducteurâ€. D'ailleurs, Afeela dÃ©rive du mot â€œfeelâ€.
Afeela, dÃ©couverte du prototype en direct du CES 2023
Si Honda est chargÃ© de dÃ©velopper les moteurs Ã©lectriques, la techno est signÃ©e Sony. L'habitacle de ce premier modÃ¨le dispose d'un Ã©cran intÃ©grÃ© qui recouvre toute la surface de la planche de bord. Cela rappelle l'habitacle de la Honda e. Plus qu'une voiture, l'Afeela est un salon roulant capable de divertir ses passagers Ã  travers la musique, la vidÃ©o et les jeux vidÃ©o. Avec un peu de chance, on pourrait mÃªme jouer Ã  la PlayStation Ã  son bord, mais cela n'a pas encore Ã©tÃ© confirmÃ©.
Pour faire de son modÃ¨le un bijou de technologie, Sony Honda Mobility a fait appel Ã  Qualcomm qui fournira les puces Snapdragon, et Ã  Epic Games, pour son moteur de jeu Unreal Engine.
